column4: in the file /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/05aptitude I have this: aptitude::Keep-Unused-Pattern "^linux-image.*$ | ^linux-restricted-modules.*$";. WHY???
so you can go back to an older kernel if the new one fries on you
but somehow I cannot install the new kernel with aptitude, only with the graphical package manager.
is that normal?
that's odd, considering they read from the same package list. i have the opposite problem, the graphical update thingie doesn't install packages anymore
nice :-)
but you don't have any solution for it now?
nope, it should definitely be appearing in aptitude too
it does appear in aptitude, but is not installed. Aptitude says it won't install it
it should tell you why it won't install it if you hit return on the package
there most likely be a package in red
I'm talking about aptitude in a shell
oh just from the command line?  try running the curses gui and find the package and drill down into it
most likely you need to update and dist-upgrade
no... I like command-line package-management. There should be no need for a gui. I'll have another try...
then figure out the appropriate apt-* command.  otherwise just use the gui that makes it obvious
alright...
dist-upgrade works... :-)
that gave you the new kernel?
right. linux-image-2.6.15-27-386
excellent.  i personally use the curses gui all the time, makes updates much easier to review.  i just hit u, U, and g
